snippet: A psychologist’s long-ago experiment shows how two groups of 12-year-olds rose above taunting and name-calling: by facing goals that transcended group concerns. Government leaders might learn from it.
abstract: N Gregory Mankiw Economic View column suggests that a psychologist’s 1954 summer camp experiment shows how two groups of 12-year-olds rose above taunting and name-calling by facing goals that transcended group concerns; contends that government leaders might look to lessons from that experiment to find common ground.
